content: "{\"object\":\"value\",\"document\":{\"object\":\"document\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"SVN (Subversion Version Control System)\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{}}},{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" is a free centralized versioning control system, e.g. the data is kept in a single storage. This storage may be located on a local disk or on a network server.  Users copy files from the storage, creating working local copies, then make changes in the working copies and record these changes in the storage. Several users can access the storage simultaneously. When new versions are saved, the system tracks the differences between the new version and the old version and records them without duplicating the data. \",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-span-mark\",\"data\":{\"style\":{}}}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Each project at EPAM can have a SVN repository as part of its project infrastructure. Your Project Coordinator/Project Manager will provide you with more details on
